intro: Julbernardia bifoliolata, commonly known as the two-leafed julbernardia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with two small leaflets. The tree produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
